request_process.who_can_request: Any person (must be U.S. legal resident)
request_process.how_to_request: Written request to agency's designated open-records officer
required_information: Identification or description of requested records
Medium in which record is requested
Name and address of person requesting access
Statement that request is made pursuant to Right-to-Know Law

agency_response_time.initial_response: 5 business days (deemed denied if no response)
agency_response_time.fulfill_request: 30 days from response date unless scope requires extension

fees.duplication: Fees established by Office of Open Records
fees.enhanced_electronic_access: User fees subject to Office of Open Records approval

request_process.appeals_process: 15 business days to appeal to Office of Open Records; 30 days for appeals officer determination; 30 days to petition court of common pleas

key_exemptions: Trade secrets and confidential proprietary information
Personal financial information not publicly accessible
Records identifying children 17 years or younger
Employee personal information (home addresses, phone numbers, etc.)
Law enforcement officer and family member personal information
Adoption and custody proceedings involving minors
Records sealed by court order or protected by federal/state law
notable_features: Presumption that all agency records are public
Office of Open Records provides centralized appeals process
Required designation of open-records officer for each agency
Deemed denial after 5 business days of no response
Civil penalties for bad faith denials
Attorney fees available for successful requesters
Training and advisory opinion services provided by oversight office
